It appears that most people decided to choose the possibility of death on the battlefield over the certainty of dishonorable death as a coward.
translation: “他们在黎明时分把他领到了墙边。他拒绝了给他递来的最后一根烟，但是同意他们为他蒙上眼睛。他在遗言中为给母亲所带来的伤痛抱歉。行刑队已经瞄准完毕。几分钟后，来检查尸体的军医证明他已经死了。”\n\n虽然无法逮捕所有逃兵役的人，但是当局已经逮捕了其中的一大批分子。鉴于我们现在所处的严峻局势，陆军部决定根据军法来审判这些没有尽自己公民责任的人。第一批死刑判决已经下达，被判处死刑的逃兵已经被行刑队处决了。这些措施已经产生了非常明显的效果。看来，大部分的人认为在战场上光荣的战死总比在国内以懦夫的身份被处决要光彩得多。

original: A shame that it had to come to this.
translation: 这是他们必的耻辱。

original: A martyr for peace
translation: 为和平献身的烈士

original: They led him to the wall at the break of dawn. He refused a last cigarette, but accepted the blindfold. His last words were an apology to his mother for causing her so much pain. The firing squad aimed well. A few minutes later, the doctor present declared him dead."\n\nThe published report of the execution of a man sentenced to death for failing to report for duty seems to have had the opposite effect. Rather than bringing people back to the colors out of fear of the consequences, it has made those executed into instant martyrs for the peace movement. Their names and life stories have been published and very clearly edited to make them appear in the best possible light. Mass peace demonstrations have started in several major cities, demanding an end to the war. The War Office reports that they have received a number of letters of draftees stating openly that they will not appear for duty - saying that they would not, under any circumstances, be party to another execution except as the person to be executed.
translation: “他们在黎明时分把他领到了墙边。他拒绝了给他递来的最后一根烟，但是同意他们为他蒙上眼睛。他在遗言中为给母亲所带来的伤痛抱歉。行刑队已经瞄准完毕。几分钟后，来检查尸体的军医证明他已经死了。”\n\n对一个逃兵役者的公开处决似乎起到了和预期相反的效果。这并没有让人们带到对拒服兵役后果的恐惧中，反而让那些被处决者成为了参加和平运动的牺牲者。被处决者的名字和生平已经在经过精心地编辑后出版，这将他们的经历变成了全国人民心中的焦点。大规模的和平示威已经开始在各大主要城市出现，人们要求我们立刻停止战争。陆军部报道说他们接到了很多新兵的信件，他们公开表示，除非让行刑队射杀他们，他们绝不会加入到行刑队中。

original: Things have not necessarily improved.
translation: 事情未必得到了改善。

original: A New Deal for [Root.GetNameDef]
translation: 一个与[Root.GetNameDef]的新协议。

original: In a radio transmitted speech today, [Root.GetLeader] announced what he called a "Social Revolution". Over the next hour, he laid out a system of reforms that touch every part of social life, promising every returning soldier an education, a well-paying job and a generous pension. He also announced a major building programm for affordable housing for young families, to begin the day an armistice is signed. This appears to have had a significant effect on general morale. Recruitment offices across the country report conscripts appearing and asking about options to extend their service beyond the current conflict, with others all but demanding a posting to frontline units to ensure extra benefits.
translation: 在今天的广播演讲中，[Root.GetLeader]宣布了他所谓的“社会革命”。在接下来的一个小时里，他向所有人陈列了他的社会改革计划，这涉及到了社会里面的方方面面。他承诺每一个退伍军人都将得到进一步的教育，高薪工作与更高的养老金。他还宣布了一项为年轻新家庭提供经济适用房的建筑项目，并在停战协议签署的当天开始实行。这似乎对人民的总体凝聚力产生了重大影响。征兵办公室报道说，很多应招者询问自己是否可以在战争结束后继续服役，另外一些人则希望自己能前往前线以此来谋取更高的福利。

original: And we pay for all this how...?
translation: 那么谁来为此买单呢？

original: Order Restored
translation: 秩序已经恢复

original: Moving quickly, Military High command mobilized a number of training units for service and formed ad-hoc groups of soldiers on leave. Marching these formations past the gates of the factories had the desired effect, as most strikers did not want to force a confrontation with potentially deadly consequences. The few that did try to persuade the soldiers to make common cause found their words having little effect as soldiers asked why the workers in the cozy rear should be allowed to let down the fighting men on the front.
translation: 最高军事统帅部用最快的速度，把那些已经训练有素的新部队派遣到岗位，用于替换那些应该得到休假的老兵们。工厂大门外整齐行进的士兵们起到了很好的威慑作用，抗议者当中没人愿意冒着生命危险来与部队对抗。有些人尝试说服士兵加入示威，但是士兵们对大后方工人为何罢工进行了反问，这些抗议者知道他们的妖言没有一点用处。

original: Why indeed.
translation: 说得对。

original: Bloody Monday
translation: 血腥星期一

original:
Moving quickly, Military High command mobilized a number of training units for service and formed ad-hoc groups of soldiers on leave. Moving these formations to the affected cities proved a lot more difficult than expected, however, as the strikers blocked railway lines and forced the troops to march in on foot, giving them ample time to prepare. When our troops reached the barricaded factories, they found the strikers ready for them. Attempts to clear roads were met with furious attacks by the workers throwing stones and bottles at the soldiers. 

In several instances, the troops opened fire to defend themselves, killing a number of strikers and wounding scores more. this only enraged the mob even further, with screams of "Murderers!" filling the air from bystanders. The mood in the capital turned dramatically in favor of the strikers. At nightfall, the soldiers retreated, leaving the barricades intact.

There have been no further attempts to force the situation. The strikers remain in control of the factories, and no work is being done.
translation:
最高军事指挥部用很快的速度，把那些训练有素的新部队派遣到岗位，用于替换那些应该得到休假的老兵们。然而，由于罢工者封锁了铁路，部队不得不使用步行的方式前往目的地，这给了罢工者们反应与准备的时间，也加大了部队进驻罢工城市的困难度。当我们的部队抵达罢工工厂时，他们发现罢工者早就准备好对付他们了。工人们向士兵投掷石块和瓶子，以此来阻止士兵清理壁垒。

在有些地方，军队向罢工者开了枪，打死了一些人，被流弹打伤的人比死的更多，这些流血事件给本已严峻的局势火上浇油，暴民们开始变得愈加愤怒并指责我们的军人是“杀人犯”。就连首都内大部分人的声音都戏剧性的导向了罢工者。夜幕降临后，士兵们并没有继续拆除壁垒而选择撤退。

军队后来也没有继续实行强硬的措施来处理壁垒的问题。罢工者得以继续控制他们的工厂，全国的罢工仍在继续。

original: Not as planned.
translation: 计划赶不上变化。

original: Heroes on the Production Front
translation: 生产线上的英雄

original:
Industrial war is more than just divisions marching and planes bombing. It is more than just the duty of a soldier to fight and die for their country. An industrial war is won, first and foremost, in the factories and foundries. To abandon the battle on the assembly line is no better than abandoning it on the front line. And the victories of the assembly line should be celebrated just as much as the ones won by the front line."

All available propaganda resources have been rerouted to show the work of the armaments workers in the best possible light. [Root.GetLeader] has personally approved a new award to be given out for workers who have exceeded their quota by more than 100%, and the first recipients have been sent on tours around the country to instruct other workers in their methods.

It appears that this has made a lot of the strikers reconsider their stance. Work has ressumed in all previously affected factories.
translation:
“工业化战争不仅仅是陆军冲锋和飞机丢炸弹。为了国家鞠躬尽瘁，死而后已也不仅仅是军人的专利。若想赢得战争，必先在工厂和锻造厂的生产上取得胜利。生产线上的胜负与前线战场上的胜负都缺一不可。同样在装配线上的成功与在前线取得军事成果是相辅相成的。”

国内的所有的宣传机器也开始全力讲解工业生产的重要性。[Root.GetLeader]也已经宣布政府会奖励超额完成任务的工人，第一批受奖者已经开始在全国各地教授他们的高效秘诀。

这项举措使得很多罢工者开始重新思考自己的举措。很多遭罢工潮波及到的工厂也开始重新开工。

original: Heroes one and all.
translation: 所有人都是英雄。

original: The War Production Department
translation: 战争生产部

original: [Root.GetLeader] today announced some small changes to the draft. While skilled workers were previously exempted from the military draft, this exception has now been removed and all exempt men drafted immediately. At the same time, the War Office has been authorized to take direct control of any factory that produces goods relevant to the war effort if the leadership of those factories has shown a lack of ability.\n\nThe announcement was met with silent resignation in the affected cities, especially once it was announced that anyone resisting would be treated the same as a soldier who refused to follow orders. While morale amongst the workers in the factories is at rock-bottom, production has restarted.
translation: 今天[Root.GetLeader]宣布了对草案的一项小小的修改。虽然以前技术熟练的工厂工人可以免服兵役，但是由于局势所迫，这个特权将会被政府收回，而那些被免除兵役的人现在都必须重新被征入伍。同时，陆军部也会获权直接接管那些管理部门过于软弱无能的军需品工厂。\n\n在被这个命令影响的城市里，人们无声地接受了这条命令，因为所有抗命者都会被直接强征入部队。尽管工厂工人们的士气变得极其低落，但是生产的确重新开始了。

original: Should have done that from the start.
translation: 我们从一开始就该这么做。

original: A country in defiance
translation: 一个陷入反抗的国家

original: [Root.GetLeader] today announced some small changes to the draft. While skilled workers were previously exempted from the military draft, this exception has now been removed and all exempt men drafted immediately. At the same time, the War Office has been authorized to take direct control of any factory that produces goods relevant to the war effort if the leadership of those factories has shown a lack of ability.\n\nThe announcement was met with great laughter in the affected cities, especially once it was announced that anyone resisting would be treated the same as a soldier who refused to follow orders. Policemen sent to deliver draft notices to workers were told to come back with more than ink on paper.
translation: 今天[Root.GetLeader]宣布了对草案的一项小小的修改。虽然以前技术熟练的工厂工人可以免服兵役，但是由于局势所迫，这个特权将会被政府收回，而那些被免除兵役的人现在都必须重新被征入伍。同时，陆军部也会获权直接接管那些管理部门过于软弱无能的军需品工厂。\n\n这项命令在受影响的城市里引起了哄堂大笑，尤其是听到所有抗命者都会被直接强征入部队这一条要求时。派去送入伍通知书的警察被工人们告知有本事就带点除了墨水以外的东西。

original: Perhaps we should.
translation: 也许我们真该带一点别的东西

original: Useful Eaters
translation: 民以食为天

original: Without mentioning the strikes taking place, [Root.GetLeader] announced today that workers in war-relevant industries will get extra rations of sugar, coffee and meat to maintain their strength. Sadly, the rumors that the government was willing to hand out extra chocolate turned out to be false.\n\nWhile the ringleaders of the strike try to keep the workers from returning to work, most seem to have accepted that "Peace and Bread" were never going to happen and are happy with just the bread.
translation: [Root.GetLeader]今天早上并没有提到罢工的发生，反而表示所有军需品工厂的工人们将得到更多的糖、咖啡豆与肉类配给以维持他们的身体所需。不过令人难过的是，之前传言政府还会增加巧克力配给的消息并没有得到落实。\n\n尽管罢工的领导人试图阻止工人们重回岗位，但是大部分的工人都已经接受了“和平与面包”不会一起到来的事实，而在现在，他们只想抓住那块“面包”。

original: They better earn their keep.
translation: 他们最好能一直保持现在的状态。

original: Operation Black Oak
translation: 黑橡树行动

original: The troops assembled outside the towns overnight, maintaining noise and light discipline to keep the element of surprise. As the sun crept over the horizon and the workers manning the barricades at the factories looked forward to relief by the day shift, the assault columns moved in. The tired workers were sluggish to organize the resistance and quickly overcome. Leaving a small detachment to guard the prisoners, the troops sweept the town, arresting everyone on the list of known factory workers. By noon, the military had taken full control of the cities and instituted a curfew. No further resistence is expected. The majority of workers will soon be released on the condition that they return to work, the ring leaders will be held and put on trial. Death sentences are expected to be handed down.
translation: 部队趁着夜色悄悄接近城外，他们严格地遵守着部队的噪音与灯光条例以此来确保行动的隐蔽性。太阳升起时，在壁垒旁值夜班的工人们盼望着一会后的轮班可以让他们好好地休息一下。疲倦的工人们很难再组织抵抗并迅速地被军人们所制服。在留下一支小部队来看管被制服的工人后，军队迅速控制了整个城市并逮捕了所有在名单上的工人。到了中午，军队已经完全控制了城市并开始戒严。在后续行动中他们没有遭到进一步的阻力。大多数的工人在同意立刻重新开工的条件后便被释放了，而罢工的核心领导人则被拘留并等待法庭的审判。他们预计会被法院判处死刑。

original: Order has been restored.
translation: 命令必须得到执行。

original: The Battle of Oak Street
translation: 橡树街之战

original: The troops assembled outside the towns overnight, but poor light and noise discipline gave the surprise away. As the troops moved in, they found the workers alert and ready for them. The first assault broke down in hails of thrown stones. A second assault with fixed bayonets was repulsed in brutal hand-to-hand fighting, leaving dozens of dead and dying in the streets.\n\nThe officers in charge have pulled back to consolidate their forces, while the workers are extending their fortifications and arming themselves with the weapons left behind in the retreat. A second day of fighting is expected tommorrow, but Military High Command does no longer believe that victory is likely.
translation: 部队趁着夜色悄悄接近城外，但是他们微弱的光线和噪音还是被守夜的工人们发现了。当部队开进城市时，他们发现工人们早已做好准备抵抗了。一开始工人们还只用石块来攻击入城的部队。但后来他们就开始用固定刺刀与军人们进行近战搏斗，这造成了数十人的死伤。\n\n部队指挥官已经让部队撤出城市重新组织，而工人们也开始加固壁垒，并开始用士兵们仓促撤退时遗留的武器武装自己。战斗预计在第二天正式打响，但是军事总指挥部的指挥官们不再敢肯定行动会成功。

original: We are quickly running out of options.
translation: 我们没有选择。

original: The Worker's Rights Protection Act
translation: 工人权利保护法案

original: With tensions running high across the capital, [Root.GetLeader] announced a new law to protect the rights of workers even in times of war. The sweeping legislation mandates paid sick leave without limits, mandatory accident insurance for every worker, the right to join any union as well as, for the first time, the right for any employed women to have maternity leave after the birth of a child.\n\nWhile many in the government consider this nothing less than a complete surrender to the strikers, the results are conclusive: work has resumed in all factories.
translation: 随着首都的紧张气氛愈加激烈，[Root.GetLeader]宣布了一项在战争时期能及时保护工人利益的法案。这项全面的立法规定了带薪病假、每个工人的强制事故保险、参加任何工会的权利，以及首次给予雇用女工在生完孩子后休产假的权利。\n\n虽然许多政府中的人认为这不过是对罢工者的彻底投降，但结果是确凿的：所有工厂都恢复了工作。

original: Hopefully this will be enough.
translation: 希望这样就足够了。

original: Mutiny Crushed
translation: 镇压叛变。

original: After a few hours of tense negotiations at barracks gates and in front line dugouts, the mutiny in our army is over. Faced with the prospect of a fight they could not win, the mutineers quickly decided to stand down. \n\nThe primary issue then became the fate of those that had refused orders. Military High Command has opted for clemency and assured the mutineers that they would not be punished harshly. A few examples have been made in which some soldiers were demoted to a lower rank and transferred to a different unit.
translation: 在兵营大门和前线防空洞经过数小时紧张的谈判，我军的反叛已经得到了平息。面对无法赢得胜利的前景，叛军很快选择了放弃抵抗。\n\n主要问题便是那些拒绝命令士兵的命运。军事最高统帅部选择宽大处理，并向叛变者保证他们不会受到严厉的惩罚。举例来说，其中一些士兵被降级到较低级别，并转移到不同的作战单位。

original: Let's hope that is the last of it.
translation: 让我们希望这是最后一次吧。

original: An empty threat
translation: 开弓不放箭。

original: Attempts to scare the mutineers into submission have backfired spectacularly as the troops showed little fear of the units sent to supress them. Using skills honed on the front lines, they quickly organized a defense of their positions that would make any attempt to defeat them very costly. \n\nThe officers in charge of the loyalist units have pulled back and are awaiting further orders, but this small success has no doubt strengthened the mutineers' resolve.
translation: 当叛军稍微表现出了一点对来镇压他们的军队的恐惧时，胁迫叛军投降的企图便会产生巨大的反效果。利用在前线磨练出来的技能，他们很快组织起来保卫自己的阵地，这将使任何试图击败他们的企图都将花费巨大的代价。\n\n负责镇压反叛军的军官已经撤离并等待着进一步的命令，但这小小的成功无疑增强了反叛者的决心。

original: No one could have predicted this.
translation: 没有人能预料到这一点。

original: What ARE we fighting for?
translation: “我们为什么而战？”

original:
It's not uncommon for a soldier to doubt whether what he is doing is really worth it. Can anything justify the sacrifices we ask of you? Can we really demand you to potentially die in pursuit of a goal that you would never see?

It is an unfortunate fact that we must live in the times we were born in. Fate has decided that we must be at war, to protect our freedom, our homes, our [Root.GetAdjective] way of life! We did not choose this war, it was forced on us! You know that I would not ask anything of you that I would not be willing to do myself, and I know that you will do whatever is necessary to secure victory."

[Root.GetLeader]'s speech in front of the troops appears to have had the desired effect, as the soldiers broke out in spontaneous cheers and returned to their duties without more than the usual amount of complaining.
translation:
一个士兵会怀疑他所做的事是否真的值得，这种情况其实并不罕见。有什么能证明我们所要求的牺牲是正当的吗？我们真得能要求你们冒着风险去追求一个遥不可及的目标吗？

现实总是不幸的，但是我们只能生活在我们出生的时代。命运已经决定了，我们必须在战争中保护我们的自由，我们的家园，我们[Root.GetAdjective]生活方式！我们并没有选择这场战争，这是敌人强加于我们的！你们都知道，如果我自己都不愿意去做，我同样也不会强加于你们；而我唯一知道的是，你们会尽一切努力来取得胜利。"

[Root.GetLeader]的在部队面前的讲话似乎已经取得了预期的效果，因为士兵们在自发的欢呼声中沸腾了，毫无怨言地回到了自己的岗位。

original: Good speech.
translation: 说得不错。

original: The Treason In War Act
translation: 战争叛国行为

original:
While the War Office is doing its best to keep the current mutiny in the army from becoming widely known, censoring letters can only go so far. Soldiers on leave quickly spread the word that the army is no longer willing to bleed needlessly in this war.

Without mentioning the mutiny specifically, [Root.GetLeader] announced today that the government would now consider any act that reflected a lack of commitment to the war to be treason.

The punishment for treason is well known, and public support for the mutineers has all but evaporated. News of this was, of course, widely spread. Seeing little support from the general population, the soldiers have quietly resumed their duties.
translation:
尽管陆军部正在尽最大努力防止当前军队中的叛乱变得广为人知，但信件审查只能做这么多了。休假的士兵很快就传播了军队不再愿意在战争中流血的消息。

虽然没有刻意提及到叛变，[Root.GetLeader]宣布政府现在把任何对战争不出力的行为视为叛国。

对叛国罪的惩罚是众所周知的，而公众对反叛者的支持已经消失殆尽。当然，这一消息也广为传播。士兵们看不到民众的支持，也已经悄悄地回到了他们的岗位。

original: We shouldn't have to spell this out.
translation: 我们不必把这个说出来。

original: Crackdown Attempt Fizzles
translation: 尝试镇压失败

original: While the War Office is doing its best to keep the current mutiny in the army from becoming widely known, censoring letters can only go so far. Soldiers on leave quickly spread the word that the army is no longer willing to bleed needlessly in this war.\n\nAttempts by the government to stem the tide have completely failed. Reports from the Secret Police indicate that the mutineers have a strong backing in the general public, making it unlikely that we can isolate and surpress them.
translation: 尽管陆军部正在尽最大努力防止当前军队中的叛乱变得广为人知，但信件审查只能做这么多了。休假的士兵很快就传播了军队不再愿意在战争中流血的消息。\n\n政府试图阻止叛变潮流的努力完全失败了。秘密警察的报告表明，叛变者在公众中有强大的支持，使我们不可能孤立和镇压他们。

original: This disrespect for laws is deeply worrying.
translation: 这种对法律的不尊重令人深感忧虑。

original: The [Root.GetAdjective] Peace Offer
translation: [Root.GetAdjective]和平协议

original:
[Root.GetLeader] announced to the press today that his latest peace offer has failed. While the causes for this unfortunate turn of events are very complex, the [Root.GetAdjective] demand that the other side pay for all damages caused, disarm completely and publically acknowledge that they started the war may have been the final straw.

Our enemies have responded in kind, calling our reasonable requests a demand for unconditional surrender. They have promised that they will prosecute this war until the bitter end. 

With our enemies evidently unwilling to see reason and promising to fight on, attempts by the mutineers to force a peace settlement have collapsed.
translation:
[Root.GetLeader]今天向媒体宣布，他最新的和平提议已经失败。造成这种不幸事件的原因非常复杂，[Root.GetAdjective]要求对方支付所造成的一切损失，完全解除武装并公开承认他们开始的战争是毫无价值的。

我们的敌人同样回应声称我们合理的要求就是“无条件投降”的意思。他们声明这场战争将至死方休。

由于我们的敌人显然不愿意看到有继续作战的理由并承诺继续作战，叛军强迫和平的计划破产。

original: Terrible shame.
translation: 这真是极大的耻辱。

original: Military Crackdown succeeds.
translation: 武装镇压成功

original: Despite a few instances in which small groups of mutineers decided to make a fight out of it, our operation to crush the rebellion has been a stunning success. Relying on numbers rather than skill, loyalist militias surrounded the muntineers' strongholds and demanded their surrender. Most soldiers decided not to take up arms against their own countrymen and surrendered peacefully. \n\nThe ringleaders will be tried in secret court martials, but the average soldier will be sent back to the front, albeit in a different unit to prevent mutineers from forming new cells.
translation: 尽管少数叛变团体决定进行反抗，但我们的镇压行动取得了压倒性的成功。依靠数量而不是技巧，亲政府民兵包围了叛军的据点并要求他们投降。大多数士兵决定不对自己的同胞兵戈相向，和平投降。\n\n叛军的头目将在秘密军事法庭受审，但普通士兵会被送往前线，分配进不同部队中，以此防止反叛分子产生新的有生力量。

original: Well done.
translation: 干得漂亮。

original: Brother against Brother
translation: 手足相争

original: Our attempts to prevent the elections for the Worker and Soldier Councils have escalated the situation beyond even the most pessimistic estimation. Rather than surrendering, the mutineers have formed provisional Councils, elected field commanders and set up defenses in the streets. It is clear that they aim to make a fight out of this.\n\nThe rifts in the army now run through every unit and often even between members of the same family. [Root.GetNameDefCap] stands poised at the edge of a civil war.

original: Ronnie, the Bren Gun Girl
translation: 布伦机枪女孩罗妮

original: Around a million Canadian women entered the workforce during the Second World War. They were represented in the national media by a symbol of resilience and patriotism: Veronica Foster, popularly known as Ronnie, the Bren Gun Girl. She worked for John Inglis and Company at a Toronto gun factory while her three brothers fought overseas. The posters and short movies featuring her, and women like her, participating in the war effort likely inspired the better-known media campaign around 'Rosie the Riveter', after America's entry into the war.
translation: 第二次世界大战期间，约有一百万名加拿大女性成为了劳动力。她们在国家媒体中成为了坚韧和爱国主义的象征：维罗尼卡福斯特，俗称罗妮，布伦机枪女孩。她在多伦多约翰英格利斯公司旗下的一家军工厂工作，而她的三个兄弟在海外战斗。在美国参战后，罗妮以及和她一样的女性被海报和电视重点宣传，即后来著名的“铆钉工罗西”，以此激励民众参与到对战争做出努力的行动中。

original: 'Factory work is no more difficult than housework', as the newsreels say.
